Suggestions: FSUIPC v4.84 (too much expensive, Mr. Dowson!) and Milviz B55.
I agree about FSUIPC.  There is no reason a dll file should cost that much.
For FSUIPC 4.84: Download it at schiratti.com/downson and try to unlock it with a key of a previous version, sometimes, it works.
hdRageSc2: that didn't work for me; Did it for you?
Didn't test it, however in FS2004 it works.

hdRageSc2: what actually happens is that when you're installing and you insert the key, it momentarily says "ok"; but then you enter FSX > Modules > FSUIPC (in order to set it up) and it finally tells you it's an unregistered (and limited) copy of it...

Well it works fine but,the737-600-700-900- version does not  have gauges.But the 737-800 works fantastic I wonder can you fix that It will be great
here you can download repaints for the737 
http://library.flight1.net/?cat=17
IT IS FREE :)

You can give the 737-600, 737-700 etc. the 737-800 panel by deleting the content of the panel.cfg located in FS-FolderSim ObjectsAirplanesifly 737-x00panel.xxx and inserting

[FLTSIM]
alias=iFly 737-800panel.xxx

xxx have to be replaced. This is only for the 2D Panel.

Uploaded at least twice, and even once before by you, "anonymous":
http://thepiratebay.se/search/ifly/0/3/0
Perhaps yours, with the extra 6/10 megabyte, will escape the issues plaguing "your" other torrent.
Guys, search for an article titled "FSUIPC a milk cow?" - someone please crack that damn thing!
